news.title: Word of the day
news.description:
Public float
Not all shares of a company can be bought and sold by the general investors.
Public float is the portion of a company's shares that can be publicly bought and sold.
The rest of the shares are held by promoters, institutional investors, governments, etc.

news.title: 6-day course
news.description:
Theme: tax-saver mutual funds
Day 2: Tuesday
One of the most misunderstood aspects of ELSS funds is the lock-in period itself.
The lock-in period is for 3 years from the date of investment.
If you invest on 2nd Feb 2022, you will be able to take out that money from 2nd Feb 2025 onwards.
How does this work in case of SIPs?
Each SIP instalment is treated as a separate investment.
So the money invested on 1st April 2022 will come out of lock-in on 1st April 2025; the money invested on 1st May 2022 will come out of lock-in on 1st May 2025 and so on.
Also, you don’t have to take out the money after 3 years. You can leave it invested so it continues to grow — you can take it out any time after 3 years.

news.title: Featured question
news.description:
"Why one should invest in multiple funds and stocks for 15% gain if it can be gained through Index funds ."
 
Many stock investors can get higher returns than the returns given by index funds.
Similarly, there are many mutual funds that have given returns better than index funds.
It is very simple, then.
If by investing in stocks or choosing mutual funds you can get higher returns than index funds, it makes perfect sense to not invest in index funds.
